sentences: In the early 1990s, Ben Goldberg performed alongside electric bassist Dan Seamans and percussionist Kenny Wollesen as the New Klezmer Trio.
Goldberg's musicality has influenced and inspired local musicians in the San Francisco Bay Area.
Recently Goldberg has branched out into songwriting.
His "Orphic Machine" project, largely commissioned by Chamber Music America, was performed in Los Angeles.

Regarding songwriting and composing, in a 2010 profile piece in All About Jazz, Goldberg said, "I don't just want to give people something that they can appreciate or understand, or that makes them think, or something like that.
"In 2011, Goldberg was named the No. 1
